fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently there's no built-in feature to gather following information for all projects in JIRA:
* Project name
* Project key
* Project type
* Project lead
* Amount of issues (issue count)
* Last updated date

Most of this information could be gathered manually per project, for example you could gather issue count through issue search, or project lead and type through project's "Details" page.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement a convenient way to gather this information for all projects in the instance, for example a page that could list the details for all projects or a JQL function that could retrieve this information.
fields.summary: Easier method to gather project details

fields.description:
Created on behalf of the customer from a Community post: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Cloud-API-using-quot-latest-quot-wrong-behavior/qaq-p/1081500|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Cloud-API-using-quot-latest-quot-wrong-behavior/qaq-p/1081500?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_reply&utm_content=topic]

 

While using [OAuth 2.0 (3LO) for apps|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/oauth-2-authorization-code-grants-3lo-for-apps/] to authenticate REST API calls, everything works fine with v2 and v3 URIs, but if you use 'latest' within the URI you get an error reporting that OAuth 2.0 is not enabled for this method.

For example: on add comment API :
 * [https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/xxx/rest/api/2/issue/xxx/comment] the API will succeed
 * [https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/xxx/rest/api/3/issue/xxx/comment] the API will succeed with the needed changes on the params.
 * [https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/xxx/rest/api/latest/issue/xxx/comment] the API will fail with the following error message "OAuth 2.0 is not enabled for this method." 

 

*Expected results:*

API authenticates correctly and returns a response

 

*Actual results:*

API authentication fails while stating OAuth 2 is not enabled

 

*Workaround:*

Do not use latest within the URI and only use v2 or v3.
fields.summary: Using "latest" in REST API endpoints returns OAuth 2.0 is not enabled for this method

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 20 Apr 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72393. This is a current and verified bug in Jira, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.

{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Custom icons uploaded to Jira meant to be used as issue type's icons will look bigger than the default ones.

That happens because the default icons have a white border around them:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

It is not noticeable because of the UI being white.

The different will be noticeable when comparing a custom icon with the default ones:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-21 at 14.25.25 (1).png|thumbnail!

The icons actually have the same size since Jira will resize the image to 16x16, but the white border will impact in the visualisation.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
 * Next-gen projects
 * Classic Projects  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Upload a custom icon to an issue type;
 * See the difference in a view like in the backlog.

h3. Expected Results

The icons should not have such disparity.
h3. Actual Results

The custom icons will always look bigger.
h3. Workaround

The only way to have the custom icons actually match with the default ones in the UI, it would be necessary to have white borders on them as well.
fields.summary: Custom issue type icons will look bigger than the default ones

h3.Workaround
* Either disable the new issue view from the personal settings or edit the comment in the old issue view (you can do this by appending *?oldIssueView=true* to the url) and modify the value shown in the screenshot below: 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* And change it to: 
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Image no longer rendered as Thumbnail on the comment section

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* As a Jira administrator, when configuring the incoming mail handler to create Jira issues via email, it is possible to map this mail handler to a Next-Gen project.
* The mail handler works as expected however when a default value is set for a field in the project as shown in the screenshot below, the email is not deleted and duplicates gets created from the same email.
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  
** Further details on the behavior can be found below.

h3. Environment
* Cloud. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen project and set a default value for a field through the Issue type project settings. 
# Create a custom incoming mail server (IMAP).
# Create an incoming mail handler.
# Map it to the Next-Gen project
# Send an email to the incoming address

h3. Expected Results
* A Jira issue is created.
* The email is not processed again. 

h3. Actual Results
* The Jira issue is indeed created.
* However, in the logs we can see the error "Unable to create issue with message".  The Stacktrace can be found on the internal comment. 
* The entry *ISSUE_CREATED_FROM_EMAIL* is not added to the *notificationinstance* table. 
* The email is read however after a period of time it is processed again by the mail handler and a new Jira issue is created. 
 
h3. Notes
* In my tests a Jira issue is created every 60 minutes from the same email.

h3.Workaround
* The email has to be deleted manually to avoid creating duplicates.
fields.summary: Incoming mail handler is creating duplicates when mapped to a Next-Gen project that has a default value for any field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* As a Jira admin, when trying to edit a workflow transition by adding a condition choosing the entry *"Value Field"*: 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
** The following error is thrown: Unable to find field 'null' after clicking the *ADD* button.
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type number
# Go to your workflow and try to add a condition 
# Choose the entry *"Value Field"*:
# Select the custom field, the operator and the value
# Click on ADD

h3. Expected Results
* The condition will be added and the admin can publish the workflow. 

h3. Actual Results
* An error is thrown and a red line is shown as per the screenshot below: 
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  
** when editing the condition there is no parameters saved in it.

h6. Notes: 
* Please find further details in the internal comment.

h3.Workaround
* For now we don't have yet a workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin I cannot add Value based conditions to workflow transition

fields.description:
Created from a Community post: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Automatically-link-a-confluence-page-to-a-JIRA-ticket-as-the/qaq-p/1083486?]

 

At the moment when we paste a jira issue's link into a confluence page, it automatically specifies the confluence page as "mentioned on" on the JIRA issue.


Now what I want to do is the same thing to happen but instead of having the confluence page specified as "mentioned on", I want it to directly go as "Confluence pages".

I know it is possible to do it directly on the JIRA issue but it is something I have to directly do opposed to the action I described above.



Basically I have a User Story issue in JIRA and I am writing the details of said US(requirements, acceptance criteria, etc) in a confluence page so I want my US specs of the confluence page directly linked to the jira issue when I paste it in confluence.

A good representation of what I get if I only copy paste jira issues in confluence is this :



!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/55257i727AD24AC54E437F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!


What I want is to have the following when working in confluence(and not having to go back to the jira issue and work on it directly) :

 

!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/55260iC96EDD3137DEDE1B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
fields.summary: Link Confluence pages without mentioned in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When linking issues, issues from projects where I do not have permission to link are displayed.

The link will not work (which is expected), and there will be a message that's pretty much misleading since it gives the idea that you should be able to perform that link:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-17 at 09.21.31 (1) (1).png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure you do not have permission to link in the project *B*;
* Make sure you have permission to link in the project *A*;
* Try to link issues from an issue in the project *A*, you will be able to see issues from project *B*.

h3. Expected Results

Issues from project *B* should not be displayed.


h3. Actual Results

Issues from project *B* are displayed.

h3. Workaround

In case you see that error message when linking issues, check the *Link Issues* permission in the target project.
fields.summary: When linking issues, you will see issues from projects where you do not have permission to link

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
* All of a sudden, some users are unable to assign an issue to other users even though the users have the "Assignable user" and "assign issue" permission. using the Permission helper, you can validate the right permission exist but you're unable to get the desired user on the "Assignee" field

h3.*Expected*
* A list of users should be visible upon typing a character of a specific user.

h3.*Actual Result*
* no user list is displayed with the result "No option"
* one or two users are returned on the list. The specific user can't be searched.
 !no-option.png|thumbnail! 

h3.*Workaround*
* Check the Screen of the Project for the "*Create/Edit/View*" and ensure that the "Assignee" Field is added.
fields.summary: Unable to assign users in projects on the Assignee field on the new issue view

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Click on the user profile icon, select "Personal settings".
 # In the "Your timezone" section select "GMT Offset" and then one of the options, such as "GMT-12".
 # Press "Save changes".

A "Couldn't save your preferences" notification appears.

When request is sent, the JSON looks like

{{{"timezone":"GMT Offset/GMT+12","locale":"en_US","notify":false,"userNotificationsMimeType":"html"}}}

The {{timezone}} attribute should probably be {{"Etc/GMT+12"}}.
fields.summary: Changing the user's time zone to a "GMT Offset" one doesn't work

fields.description:
In Slack Integration, we want notifications for ticket status change, but instead of just showing the status change, it also unfurls the description into the channel, making it hard to notice what changed, and overall bloating the channel with unnecessary redundant text making it unnecessarily hard to read.

!image-2019-05-21-12-52-58-227.png!

Not seeing how to stop this.

I of course can't just show you our proprietary company information from an example, so I'm hoping you know how this feature works and are willing to test to see how it operates or send it to the developers for review.

It's a hindrance on readability in the Slack channel that the team uses including non-developers who may not understand the description fully.
fields.summary: Status change shows ticket description in Slack unfurl

fields.description:
h3. Description:

When Copying a workflow using the "Copy" action on the Workflows page (ListWorkflows.jspa), the UUID of every Connect post-function is not regenerated, resulting in two independent post-functions sharing the same UUID.

So, when third-party apps use Jira REST API it returns HTTP 500 if post-function ID is not globally unique.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a post-function with some app action in the workflow A
 # Export the workflow XML and search for the field remoteWorkflowPostFunctionUUID
 # Copy the workflow A to generate the workflow B
 # Export the workflow XML of the workflow B and search for the field remoteWorkflowPostFunctionUUID
 # Will be the same UUID

We created a video reproducing this problem as you can see here: [^JRACLOUD-72099.mp4]
h3. Expected results:
 * It is expected to each post-function within the workflow have different UUID

h3. Actual results:
 * Duplicated UUID in the new copy workflow.

h4. Notes

This happens because it is not generating a new UUID when copying the workflow.
h3. Workaround
 * Delete the post-function and add it again.
fields.summary: Copying a workflow using the "Copy" action cause to the UUID of Connect post-function being duplicated

fields.description:

In the Old Issue View, while editing the Description field, there was a scroll, so it wouldn't scroll down all issue. It should be good if it worked the same way in the New Issue View.

Have the scroll inside the Description field, while editing the field.

h3. Actual Results
There isn't a scroll on it.
fields.summary: Scroll Inside Description Edit New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing an issue assignee via a post function shows an edit is performed by the user noted in the post function under the users profile *"Worked on"* activity feed, but on the issue directly under the issue history the User that performed the edit is listed as expected and is causing a data discrepancy between the two locations issue history tracking mechanisms.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a post function to a workflow:
#*  "Update Issue Field"
#* Issue Field = Assignee
#* Field value = a defined user
# Transition the issue through the transition with the workflow
# Navigate to the users profile was listed in the Post function

h3. Expected Results
The User that executed the transition will show the edit under their profile matching the value under the issue history tab and no edit event is shown under the uses profile that was added to the issue

h3. Actual Results
The user that is noted in the post function will show as editing the issue under the "Worked On" activity feed while it shows the user that executed the transition as the one that edited the issue under issue history causing a data inconsistency.

h3.Workaround
Use the Issue History tab on the issue directly to identify the actual user that edited the issue
fields.summary: Changing Assignee with post function shows incorrect info in user profile activity feed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new issue view it's not possible to add more than *32670* characters in Description field, following error appears when you add a description with more than *32670* characters:
{quote}
h4. We couldn't save your content
It may contain formatting we don’t recognise. Try removing the formatting before saving.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add a text with length between *32670* to *32767* (max length) characters in Description field through new issue view and click on *Save*

h3. Expected Results
The value is saved

h3. Actual Results
The value can't be saved and following error dialog appears:
{quote}
h4. We couldn't save your content
It may contain formatting we don’t recognise. Try removing the formatting before saving.
{quote}
 
h3.Workaround
Switch to old issue view to add up to *32767* characters
fields.summary: Unable to add more than 32670 characters in Description field through new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the *Issues and filters* Project view, the Issue sorting becomes inconsistent when dealing with more than 30+ Issues.

This mainly happens when scrolling down the list of Issues where Jira needs to load the Issues down the list for the first time which sometimes makes the Issue appear twice or the sorting is way off the DESC or ASC being used.

In addition to this, when sorting between ASC and DESC, the first and last Issues are sometimes different.

In this example, with the same ASC sorting, the Issue before Issue *SL-463* is different.

 !1.png|thumbnail! 
 !2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

In my testing, this occurred more on Firefox and was harder to replicate it on Google Chrome (but I did manage to occasionally).

h3.Workaround
Use the advanced view or scroll through the Issues enough for all Issues to be loaded.
fields.summary: Project Issues and filters view is inconsistent
The 'title' for the 'Create issue' dialog h2 is 'Import issuesCreate issue'

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Editing permission (access) of filter requires users to select the "Add" button.
Lots of users miss the button and get confused about why the change isn't applied.

 !filter-permission-1.png|thumbnail!  !filter-permission-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a user-friendly experience such as:
* automatically apply the change only with selecting drop-down list
* showing notice when a user saves filter without selecting the "Add" button


h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: User-friendly UI on filter's permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* When importing a CSV file using the External System Importer: 
** specifically to a Next-Gen project 
** and more specifically when trying to map the "Issue Type" value and the "Story Point Estimate" value
** the import finishes with a successful message, 
** however, all Jira issues gets imported as *"Task"* or *"Story"* so the issue type mapping is not respected
** and, the "Story Point Estimate" value is not imported at all. 
** The import logs does not show any error related to this. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud;
* Next-Gen projects;

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-Gen project
# Verify that all issue types are mapped to the project
# Verify that "Story Point Estimate" field is among the fields of each issue type; 
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to CSV external system importer. 
# Ensure to map the "Issue Type" value and the "Story Point Estimate" value. 
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
* Both fields get imported successfully and we can see that in the Jira issue view. 
**  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

* "Story Point Estimate" field is not imported at all. 
* And, issue type is set to *"Task"* or *"Story"*.
**  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, during the CSV External System Import to a Next-Gen project, the mapping of the "Issue Type" value and the "Story Point Estimate" value is not respected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changes on Remaining Estimate are not recorded on history when the field is modified on a transition screen and by a post-function at same time.


h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On workflow, the transition to Done/Closed should have a post function to set the Remaining time to 0h
# On the same transition, add a screen containing the Time Tracking field
# Create an issue with Original and Remaining estimate
# Move the issue to Done/Closed and manually change Remaining estimate to 0h (on transition screen)
#* The issue history won't record the update on the remaining estimate


h3. Expected Results
All changes on the issue are added to its history

h3. Actual Results
The records regarding the issue updates are missing and some reports might misbehave (Burndown chart).

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Remove Time Tracking from the transition screen
fields.summary: Changes on Remaining Estimate are not recorded on history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
CSV file exported from search result contains username for user picker fields such as _Reporter_ and _Assignee_ fields. This causes the users to appear as not human readable values/strings in assignee and reporter fields, for example when the users are provisioned from an identity provider.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Provision a new user with SCIM.
# Assign an issue to the new user.
# Search for the issue.
# Export the search result as a CSV file

h3. Expected Results
The best result would be that the CSV file contains display name or email address for reporter and assignee field.

h3. Actual Results
The username appears in assignee field which will be a UUID.

h3. Notes
This is related to the work being done to remove username, please refer to following pages for further information:
* [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud]
* [Changes to usernames in Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/gdpr-changes-to-usernames-in-jira-cloud-967319102.html]

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround available at this moment!
fields.summary: CSV export contains username for user picker field like reporter and assignee fields

fields.description:
In addition to supporting markdown, make keyboard shortcuts such as cmd  option + 1-6 or ctrl + Left Alt  1-6 to set headings 1-6 available. 

Bringing over all the keyboard shortcuts available on Confluence Cloud ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/keyboard-shortcuts-markdown-and-autocomplete-724764956.html]) and having a consistent experience would be nice.

Current Scenario:

While setting up JIRA, I created multiple test projects, whose default schemes were taken from the template during creation. Even though the projects were deleted, its schemes persist and have to be deleted manually, one by one. This is annoying and not necessary. 

Ideal Scenario:

Deleting a project would delete all the associated schemes. Perhaps, the admin could get a chance to copy those schemes for future use, before the ones associated with the project are wiped. This way, the admin always has a "clean" list of schemes to work with.

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
Setting the "Linked Issues" field as required on a field configuration for a Project, doesn't validate the "Search for Issue" Input field during Issue creation. 

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Navigate to the *Project Settings > Field* Click on the edit icon to go to the Field Configuration, the make the "Linked Issues" field required
- Go to the *Project Settings > Screens* ensure the "Linked Issues" field is available on screen.
 - Go to the project and try to create an Issue
{panel}

h3.*Expected Result*
* The Issue should not be created if no value is added to the "Search for Issue" input field as it must not be empty since it's required on the field configuration.

h3.*Actual Result*
* The Issue is actually created with having the "Search for Issue" input field as empty on the Issue creation screen.
*  !field.png|thumbnail! 

h3.*Workaround*
* currently none is available.

h3.*Use Case*
* We would like to make it Mandatory to have our users choose an issue that is linked during Issue creation, however making it required then not being able validate the field, makes the feature not useful.
fields.summary: Linked Issues field set as "Required" on the field configuration doesn't validate the "Search for issue" input field

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update as of 11 November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#4c9aff|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#deebff}
I am sorry to everyone struggling with the behaviour of the REST API. This behaviour is intentional and we’ll be closing this ticket, but let me give additional context.

Note we have two different versions of the Jira API:
 * *Version 3:* This is the latest version but is in {*}beta{*}. [Version 2|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/] and [version 3|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/intro/] of the API offer the same collection of operations. However, version 3 provides support for the [Atlassian Document Format|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/structure/] (ADF) for rich text fields.

 * {*}Version 2{*}: This API supports _wikimarkup_ for text formatting and can be found [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/]. This version of the API continues to be supported and offers the full functionality of v3, simply the syntax for text formatting differs.

 * While we do support on the fly conversion of markdown in the Jira user interface, neither API supports _markdown_ via the REST API.

Your options:
 * You may continue to use [v2 of the API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/api-group-issue-comments/#api-rest-api-2-issue-issueidorkey-comment-post] along with [wikimarkup syntax|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

 * If you’d like to use v3 along with ADF, we offer the following tools to help:

 ** Documentation for the [ADF format|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/structure/].

 ** The [ADF Schema|http://go.atlassian.com/adf-json-schema] can be can be used to validate ADF documents.

 ** The [ADF Builder|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/apis/document/playground/] which provides an editor which shows the corresponding ADF.

 ** [ADF Utils|https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/packages/editor/adf-utils] is an {{npm}} module which provides a set of utilities to traverse, modify and create ADF documents.

We’ve created a ticket to track adding support for wikimarkup/ADF in the v3 api which you can follow here: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2499].

— Phil Oye, Group Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Where performing a JQL search using a user field, selecting a value from the auto-complete options will populate username.

In the case of newer users, for example those provisioned with SCIM this is a UUID and not human readable in a usable sence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Provision a new user with SCIM.
 # Assign an issue to the new user.
 # Search for this user using JQL and type the display name of the user {code} assignee = jira {code}
 # Then select this user from the autocomplete pop-up.
 !Screenshot 2019-05-16 at 10.08.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The best result would be that the auto populated value would be either display name.

h3. Actual Results
The username is populated which going forward will be a UUID.

h3. Notes
This is related to the work being done to facilitate: [Say goodbye to usernames in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud]

h3. Workaround
To workaround this avoid using the auto-complete option and type the users display name or email address in quotes like {code}assignee = "nero@jira.com"{code}{code}assignee = "Nero Battlebeard Wolfgang"{code}
 !Screenshot 2019-05-16 at 10.15.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using the auto complete for JQL search on a user populates the username value which can be a UUID

h3. Summary

As a Jira user when I try to paste an attachment it shows up very large within a comment so I need to scroll back and forth to see it.

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

As you can see in the screenshot there is a bar (colored in yellow) and the user should scroll back and forth.

(Note: A video is pasted as an internal comment to describe better the behavior. )

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access to a Jira issue in the new issue view
# Try to drag and drop a large image to the comment field

h3. Expected Results
* The image is resized automatically and it shows up in a friendly and clear way to ensure a good User Experience. 
 
 OR 

* As it used to be in the old issue view, the image shows up as thumbnail. 

h3. Actual Results
* The attachment shows up unreasonably large.
 
h3. Notes
* A valid option would be to provide the administrator the option to Configure thumbnail size via attachment settings. 

Or,

* Give the user himself the option to resize the image easily.

Or, 

* Show the image as thumbnail, by default, as it used to show in the old issue view. 

h3.Workaround
* Either disable the new issue view from the personal settings or edit the comment in the old issue view (you can do this by appending *?oldIssueView=true* to the url) and modify the value shown in the screenshot below: 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* And change it to: 
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
*Background*

At Samtrafiken in Sweden we run the maintenance organization for a Public Transport standard (API's & specifications maintained in Bitbucket) involving all the external stakeholders (which are part of the community improving the standard) on the swedish Public Transport market. We use a JIRA-project [https://samtrafiken.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=40&projectKey=BOBX] to define the improvement needs of the standards specifications and documentation.

Problem: we want the external users, involved in the community enhancing the standard, to be part of the JIRA-project and to be able to *view* all the content of the JIRA-project. Today they can only view individual Issues from the specific URL sent.

NOTE: I have had a support case with an Atlassian employée leading to the realization of this described need. We tried Permission scheme: *Browse Projects/Group(Anyone)* which did not help. For me the definition - Browse *Project* tells me that all the information within the project is accessible but that is not the case - you can only access/view individual issues within the project. Then if this Suggestion is not fulfilled I guess the feed-back would be to call that Project Permission "View Issues" instead cause now the definition is misleading and causes unnecessary support/investigation time.  **  

*Need* 

As an external user not logged in to JIRA, 
I want to be able to view:
 * JIRA-project backlog
 * JIRA-project Kanban Board
 * Issue Development content
 ** Bitbucket Branches
 ** Bitbucket Commits

So that I can keep track of and view all the Issues and its prioritizations, statuses, progress and the connected realizations (Bitbucket) of the needs described in the issues in the JIRA-project I am involved in.
fields.summary: External user read access to JIRA-project & Issue information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Next-gen project is created with the same issue type as the existing classic projects, some system fields can be used in the Basic search.

Even across NextGen projects if the custom field name is not an exact match this will be disregarded since basic search fields are grouped with non-case sensitive options and then validation is called with case sensitive option.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_*Scenario 1 : System Fields*_
 # Create a classic Scrum project. Make sure that Story issue type is used by the project.
 # Create a Sprint and assign some issues.
 # Perform a basic search on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Sprint. (Works OK)
 # Create a Next-Gen scrum project. Make sure Story issue type is used by the project.
 # Try to perform a basic search again on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Sprint

_*Scenario 2 : Custom Fields*_
 # Create a classic project. Make sure that Story issue type is used by the project.
 # Create a Custom field and assign to the screens of the classic project
 # Perform a basic search on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Custom_Field. (Works OK)
 # Create a Next-Gen scrum project. Make sure Story issue type is used by the project.
 # Try to perform a basic search again on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Custom_Field

h3. Expected Results

The system and custom fields should be usable on the Basic Search.

!sprint.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The system field or custom field cannot be used on the Basic Search and it fails with the error. "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type".

!error.png|thumbnail!

Other system fields affected.
 - Fix Version
 - Component

h3. Workaround
 # Use the *Advanced* search and JQL should still work.
 # Custom fields on Nextgen should exactly match other custom fields name, if a single char is different (case sensitive) this will be disregarded.
fields.summary: Fields cannot be queried via Basic search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a *bulk edit* (any field) and you have issues from 2 next-gen projects or 1 classic + 1 next-gen project in the search result, you'll receive a 404 dead link error on the final step of the process.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two differents next-gen projects or one classic project and one next-gen project
 # Create one issue in each project
 # Assign those issues to the same user (we're gonna use assignee field as reference)
 # Do a search like *assignee = <assignee name>*
 # Try to perform a bulk edit assignee field and you'll receive a 404 error.

The same scenario was reproducible trying to edit other fields like priority, reporter, issue type...
h3. Expected Results
 * Be able to bulk edit issues

h3. Actual Results

You receive a 404 dead link
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 11.15.16.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in splunk:
{code:none}
 logger: com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.bulkedit.BulkEditBeanConverterImpl
{code}
{code:none}
 message: Failed to serialize a BulkEditBean to json
{code}
{code:none}
com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException: Null key for a Map not allowed in JSON (use a converting NullKeySerializer?) (through reference chain: com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.bulkedit.SerializableBulkEditBean["availableActions"])
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException.from(JsonMappingException.java:285)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider.mappingException(SerializerProvider.java:1251)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider.reportMappingProblem(SerializerProvider.java:1145)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.impl.FailingSerializer.serialize(FailingSerializer.java:35)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.MapSerializer.serializeTypedFields(MapSerializer.java:935)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.MapSerializer.serializeFields(MapSerializer.java:692)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.MapSerializer.serialize(MapSerializer.java:643)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.MapSerializer.serialize(MapSerializer.java:33)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.BeanPropertyWriter.serializeAsField(BeanPropertyWriter.java:727)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.BeanSerializerBase.serializeFields(BeanSerializerBase.java:719)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.BeanSerializer.serialize(BeanSerializer.java:155)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.DefaultSerializerProvider._serialize(DefaultSerializerProvider.java:480)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.DefaultSerializerProvider.serializeValue(DefaultSerializerProvider.java:319)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper._configAndWriteValue(ObjectMapper.java:3905)
	at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper.writeValueAsString(ObjectMapper.java:3219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.bulkedit.BulkEditBeanConverterImpl.toJsonThrowingError(BulkEditBeanConverterImpl.java:131)
{code}
h3. Workaround
 * Isolate the next-gen projects from your search, for example a JQL like:
{code:java}
assignee = <assignee name> and project in (<projects that are not next-gen>){code}
and bulk-edit each next-gen project separately.
fields.summary: Bulk edit gives a 404 error if you have a next-gen project in the search result

fields.description:
|*Atlassian Update - 27 May 2021*|
|Hi everyone,
 This has now been fixed for message custom fields (for view) - these now appear as read only in the new issue view and reflect markdown input. As noted in this ticket, there is no longer an edit screen in the new issue view, so the message custom field (for edit) is no longer available on this screen. 
  
 Thanks,
 The Atlassian Cloud team|

 
h3. Summary

When using the read-only *Message Custom Field (for edit)* and the *Message Custom Field (for view)* fields provided by the *JIRA Toolkit Plugin* which are designed to only display on either the view or edit screens and allow markdown inputs via the fields by default, and you switch to the new issue view the fields both become visible, and editable in the layout configurations and no longer render correctly as view and edit screens are now combined and the view uses a new editor not compatible with the markdown. however while the fields become editable the modifications are temporary and the fields will reset to the default values on a page reload if changed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With new issue view disabled
 # Add *Message Custom Field (for edit)* and the *Message Custom Field (for view)* to a screen used by both view issue and edit issue screens per the projects screen scheme
 # Set defaults for the fields and add markdown to the text
 # View the issue Note only *Message Custom Field (for view)* is visible markdown is rendered correctly
 # Edit the issue Note that only *Message Custom Field (for edit)* is visible markdown is rendered correctly
 # enable new issue view

h3. Expected Results

When viewing the issue only *Message Custom Field (for view)* is visible and markdown is rendered correctly, and *Message Custom Field (for edit)* is no longer available as there is no longer an edit screen
h3. Actual Results

Both fields are visible and markdown is rendered as plain text, the read-only values can be edited
h3. Notes

While the fields are editable in the new view the changes will reset to the default value on page refresh causing confusion as to why the value is changing
 It has been mentioned that the new issue view does not support Markup but supports markdown. After testing Markdown, this does not work either in this type of field.
h3. Workaround

There is no current work around
fields.summary: Message Custom Field on new issue view do not display correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We are getting repeated delete user webhook calls for already deleted users.
And we notice that user delete webhooks keep triggering for the same deleted users approximately once an hour.

Sample log:
{code}
2019-11-26T17:39:06+05:30 [info] application - User delete webhook event for instance = https://{instance-name}.atlassian.net with request body json = {"timestamp":1543234145911,"webhookEvent":"user_deleted","user":{"name":"removed58"}}
2019-11-26T17:39:06+05:30 [info] application - User delete webhook event for instance = https://{instance-name}.atlassian.net with request body json = {"timestamp":1543234145935,"webhookEvent":"user_deleted","user":{"name":"removed12"}}
2019-11-26T17:39:06+05:30 [info] application - User delete webhook event for instance = https://{instance-name}.atlassian.net with request body json = {"timestamp":1543234145947,"webhookEvent":"user_deleted","user":{"name":"removed77"}}
{code}

h3. How to replicate the issue
Go to Jira --> Webhooks --> Create a new webhook:
Enable the trigger for User deleted --> True

From the user management page --> Remove one user

h3. Expected behavior
The webhook should only trigger when the user is deleted from the system

h3. Actual behavior
The webhook triggers every hour listed all the deleted users in the system
fields.summary: Repeated delete user webhook calls

h3. Summary

On next-gen project, if we choose a custom icon and do not zoom it to fill the empty space, the icon is not saved and a generic error appears.

Couldn't save
There was a network problem and the project details were not updated. Try again later.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to next-gen project details and click "Change icon".
# Select a custom image.
# Try to save letting the transparent space.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you click on the result of a column in a two dimensional filter statistics gadget, and it has Epic Link in one of its axis, you will be taken to the previous search instead of the gadget's result depending on the query combination. 
 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a two dimensional filter statistics gadget;
* Set the *Epic Link* field as one of its axis;
* Select a filter. I was not able to find a specific pattern, but I was able to replicate the problem with the combinations below:
** type != *<issuetype>* AND project = *<project>*;
** type != *<issuetype>* AND *<any condition>* AND project in (*<project>*);
** type not in (*<issuetype>*, *<issuetype>*) AND *<any condition>* AND project in (*<project>*);
** type not in (*<issuetype>*, *<issuetype>*) AND *<any condition>* AND project not in (*<project>*);
** project = *<project>* AND type = *Story*. Or the other way around. For some reason, the problem occurs when the type is set as *Story*.

Here's a recording of when you click on a result of the gadget:  [^Gadget results.mp4] 







h3. Expected Results

You will be redirect to the search based in the result you've clicked on.

h3. Actual Results

You are redirected to the previous search you've performed (which is the default behaviour when you select to perform an advanced search).
 
h3. Workaround

Modify your query so it will not impact in the result.

For example, if your query is something like: *project = Project AND type = An issue type AND...*...
Separate the project and the type (issue type) conditions as most of the combinations that cause the problem are when those two are in the same query.

Create a new filter where you will only use one condition. For example: *project = Project*. Then modify the query of the filter to *filter = <filter you've created> AND type = An issue type AND...*.

That worked for me in my tests.
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter statistics gadget has inconsistent behaviour when clicking on its results if Epic link is set in one of its axis

fields.description:
Hi,

I think it would be useful to have a gadget in my dashboard that simply shows a list of selected filters. With good names on the filters it would provide a compact way to let my team access a lot of useful information as a complement to the nice gadgets that are already available.

Currently I create a Filter Results gadget for each filter with only one row displayed where the team then can click the total number of rows link to see the full filter result but it takes up unnecessarily much space in my dashboard with a separate gadget for each filter and it's not intuitive how it's supposed to be used.

Thanks,

Magnus
fields.summary: Filter list gadget for dashboards

Currently, announcement changes related to Atlassian Cloud Development are updated in https://developer.atlassian.com and https://community.developer.atlassian.com

With this, there's no way that Atlassian Cloud customers get notified about the change. There's no option to watch a blog post that updates Atlassian CLoud development changes. 

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Summary
If a description is copied from the old issue view and then pasted into an issue in the new issue view all formatting is corrupted and ADF is presented in the text of the description.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue (issue_A) using bullet points, tables, code blocks and number.
# View this (issue_A) in the old issue view.
# Click the description so it becomes editable (issue_A).
# Copy the description (issue_A).
# Create a second (issue_B) issue with a blank description.
# View this (issue_B) in the new issue view.
# Click the description (issue_B) so it is editable
# Paste the copied content from (issue_A) into (issue_B)

h3. Expected Results
The formatting is not completely broken and would display as it does if you switch between new and old issue view. 

h3. Actual Results
Formatting is completely broken including the ADF for tables being placed as plain text in the description body.
 
eg. !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Avoid copying and pasting between old and new issue view.
fields.summary: Copying description from old issue view, pasting into description of new issue view breaks all formatting and displays ADF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69326].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

When working in Jira, a project avatar is one common way that admins will customize to help users quickly sort through to identify what project they are working in. When you then have to switch applications to Confluence or alike, there is no means to automatically use the same custom avatar icon for that linked space. This can cause confusion or delays until users can be sure they are working in the correct space/project
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be awesome if when you link a Jira Project to a Confluence space, if Jira would prompt you to sync the avatar between these two. Granted, it would be understood that the user creating this link would need to have admin rights in both applications likely, and there might be a question of which avatar to use when initiating the sync. However to be able to do this automatically for admins would be really helpful in making it very clear to end users which content is linked to what other content.
h3. Note:

This suggestion does not seek to sync avatars of user objects.  Just that between spaces and projects.
fields.summary: When linking a Jira Project to a Confluence Space, there should be a quick option to sync the avatar between project and space

fields.description:
There are cases where the reporter field is exposed on transition screens. When the original reporter has already left the team, the user will no longer be allowed to be configured as a reporter. 

 !transition.png|thumbnail! 

There are use case though to keep the same reporter for the Jira issue.

Suggestion :
- Allow a toggle switch for Jira to accept inactive users as reporters. 
- Allow a view only option of the reporter field on transition screens. 

Workaround :
- Remove the transition reporter from the transition screens to skip the validation
- Restrict the Modify reporter project permission to admin users who do not need to work on the issues.
fields.summary: Allow the reporter field to accept inactive users.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
1. Create a project with versions A, B, C, D, and E (or 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, etc), A being the first version and E being the last. 
2. Create a six issues, the first with fix version as A, the second as B, and so on, then one with the fix version as A _and_ E.
3. In the Issue Navigator, run the following JQL query: {{fixVersion >= "B" AND fixVersion <= "D"}}

*Expected results*:
The issues with fix version B, C, and D are returned.

*Actual results*:
The issues with fix versions B, C, and D are indeed returned, but so is the issue with fix versions A and E.

The same issue occurs if you use just < and > instead of >= and <=.

 

Seems like the AND operator is not taking precedence

 

OLD BUG (server) for the same: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22995
fields.summary: JQL query "fixVersion >= B AND fixVersion <= D" returns unexpected results

h3. Problem Definition
Duplicate field 'Flagged created' when installing the 'Big' Plugins

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
* Start a new instance of JIRA Software site
* Add new project without any issues in it
* Check Issues > Custom fields --> *no duplicate field called Flagged created.*
* Install SoftwarePlant's BigPicture app
* Check Issues > Custom fields --> *no duplicate field called Flagged created.*
* Install SoftwarePlant's BigGantt app
* Check Issues > Custom fields --> *no duplicate field called Flagged created.*
* Install SoftwarePlant's BigTemplate app
* Check Issues > Custom fields --> *no duplicate field called Flagged created.*
* Navigate to project and add new issue via Backlog "What needs to be done?" placeholder
* Check Issues > Custom fields
* *Notice that there are two custom fields "Flagged"*

h3. Expected Result
Only one field called Flagged should be available in the system

h3. Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Duplicate field 'Flagged created' when installing the 'Big' Plugins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Jira administrator, when trying to create a transition between two statuses through the workflow *"Diagram view"*, an option to select the screen mapped to the transition shows up. 

When using the MS browser *"Edge"* an error is thrown if you don't select a value for that field. 

Th error on the UI is the following: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The error on the developer tool is the following 400 error: 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Try using MS Edge browser
# Create a new workflow
# Go to edit this newly created workflow
# select the diagram view
# ensure that you have at least two statuses
# try to create a transition between two statuses


h3. Expected Results

The screen field has a default value of *"None"*. So if no value is chosen there will be no screen mapped to the transition.  
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Actual Results

The screen field value is empty. 
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
* Look for the *"None"* value from the screen select list and choose it before saving.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User successfully authenticates using a normal password instead of API token when integrate Usabilla to JIRA. Other users only able to authenticate with API Token (which is the expected behavior)

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Usabilla with JIRA using https://support.usabilla.com/hc/en-us/articles/208744805-Integration-with-Jira documentation.
# Insert the JIRA username and password (normal password)

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should fail the authentication.

h3. Actual Results
User successfully authenticate. 

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3. Workaround
Change the password to API token.
fields.summary: Usabilla integration with JIRA allow using normal password instead of API token

h3. Summary

Fields relating to estimation (i.e., *Story Points*, *Time estimate*) are not editable with the Android app.
h3. Environment

Verified with:
 * Jira v25.0.296

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in Scrum project
 # Try editing *Story Points* field

 !Screenshot_20190508-115445.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results

A user can edit *Story Points*.
h3. Actual Results

The filed doesn't become editable after tapping the field *Story Points*.
h3. Workaround

* Add the field to the configured Screen.
* Use the web client.
* Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Editing estimation doesn't work for Android Jira App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users are trying to download attachments of issues while using the "New Jira Issue View", Jira will download the file renamed as "original", without extension.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open an issue while using the "New Jira Issue View" ([link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]);
* Try to download an attachment.

h3. Expected Results
* The name and the extension of the file is retained.

h3. Actual Results
* Jira will rename the file to "original" and remove its extension.

 [^HOT-87061.mp4] 

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, temporarily disable the "New Jira Issue View" in your Cloud instance. To achieve this:

# # Click the profile icon, on the bottom of your left sidebar, then *Personal settings*;
# On the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable the *New Jira issue view for software projects*.
fields.summary: Attachments are being downloaded as "original", without extension, when using New Jira Issue View

fields.summary: Allow sprint start and end dates to be searched by JQL and displayed as columns in filters

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When a specific JIRA issue worklog is being filled concurrently from different sources at the same time, some worklog entries are missed; resulting in inaccurate timespent value. In the case where the user also uses Tempo timetracking, there is a difference between JIRA's timespent and Tempo's. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an integrated system that operates in Jira 
# Do several work logs operations such as adding work logs to the same issue

h3. Expected Results

The time spent of the issue (shown as logged in time tracking panel) equals the sum of all existing work logs.

h3. Actual Results
Because the time spent is stored separately and there isn't a control of parallel changes in that, it may not be equal to the sum of work logged.
 
h3. Notes
We carried out 2 tests:
# A script run twice sequentially (waiting for first run to finish to start another one) where we add 60 seconds of work logs 100 times
# Same as above, but both are run at the same time in parallel

In both cases we expected 12000 seconds of time spent on that issue and that is what we got in the first test, but we got 9840 on the second as in some cases, the creation of a work log interfered with another running at the same time.

h3.Workaround
No perfect workaround, but avoiding running 2 work logs operations in the same issue prevents this problem.
fields.summary: Operation on worklogs may results in inconsistent timespent when done in parallel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the Jira Cloud <> Slack integration, when an issue and it's description appears in the slack channel any code macros are not displayed correctly. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Slack to a Jira Cloud site.
# Connect a project to a slack channel.
# Create an issue with a code macro in the description of the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The code macro is displayed correctly like in the Jira issue:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The formatting is broken and the code language is inserted in the body of text:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code block macro not displayed properly in Slack using Jira integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using *maxResults* parameter in search user REST API does not extend the results to more than 100 users. The default is 50 and *maxResults* works for up to 100 results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have more than 100 users in the instance
# Run the following cURL command:
{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?maxResults=200&query' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Get more than 100 users

h3. Actual Results
Only the first 100 users are returned.
fields.summary: Search user REST API (/rest/api/3/user/search) does not return more than 100 users
